definition[0]: a piece of thick string or thin rope
example[0]: The robe was held at the waist by a cord.
example[1]: He pulled explosives and some tangled cord from his bag.
definition[1]: an electrical wire or wires with a protective covering, usually for connecting electrical equipment to the supply of electricity
definition[2]: a specific quantity of wood cut for burning in a fire
example[4]: We use three cords of wood in a winter.
definition[3]: cord clothes are made from corduroy
